title: Fatal shooting of 14-year-old was accident, suspect tells police
content:
A Tampa man charged in the shooting death of a 14-year-old boy over the weekend was released from the Hillsborough County jail on Monday. He told deputies that the shooting was accidental and his story was corroborated by an eye witness.
Jose Antonio Cruz, 19, 4710 E. Poinsettia Ave. is charged with manslaughter. He was arrested early Sunday and released from jail after posting $15,000 bail shortly before 8 a.m. Monday.
Tampa police responded to reports of a shooting at 4611 E. Whiteway Ave., around 5:30 p.m. Saturday and found the victim, Stephenn Santiago-Grey, mortally wounded. He was taken to Tampa General Hospital where he later died, police said.
Police said Cruz and an unidentified female witness were parked in a sedan in the driveway and the victim was standing outside the open front passenger door.
Santiago-Grey was talking and joking with Cruz, who was in the driver’s seat, police said, and the witness was in the front passenger seat.
During the exchange, Santiago-Grey jokingly challenged Cruz to shoot him.
Cruz pulled a .357-caliber revolver and fired one shot, police said, striking the victim in the chest.
Police said Cruz remained at the scene and immediately surrendered to officers and told them what happened, admitting he accidentally shot the teenager. He told investigators he thought the gun was unloaded when he pointed it at the victim and pulled the trigger.
The revolver was recovered at the scene.
